Anyway. I find myself getting caught up with all the musical options and styles and ways to practice what I do and taste and everything else. I just want to know how you deal with such a saturated environment 

      you could undergo a small to decent sized handful of mental breakdowns

8.2.19  2:30 am   can you explain the concept of
"u don't even need a when"
"u don't even need a where"
"that's how ｅｖｅｒｙ it gets" in more detail?
feel free to rip my brain up and/or point me to some other reading k thx hi

      what science seems to think nowadays is that there is/was no time and space 'before' the big bang. actually i can't even say that because 'before' is a time word. where and when are irrelevant. no such thing. unless big bang happens, then there are places and times, like the ones we are familiar with today

      not wrong, just not enough

      you could try getting famous online

      rock/roll

8.1.19  4:02 am   i am deeply fascinated by you because you seem to be living in the past (working on reality), present (here, anagrams, workworkworkwork) and future (always looking forward to making the new favorite track, not living in the past, although u kinda do while editing reality, looking forward to new ways of maing new things). how do u deal with nostalgia while editting,

     a heavy suit of chain mail armor

      going through old stuff in my room is always a heavily emotional experience just because of the memories each object brings up, do u get similar experience?

     yes

      have u gotten used to it?  

     yes

     

To quote lao tsu:

"If you are depressed you are living in the past.
If you are anxious you are living in the future.
If you are at peace you are living in the present."

Do you think this applies?

     i think it deeply underrates the past and future

      Do you think the reverse applies? "if you are living in the past you are depressed, future anxious, present peace"? I just realized i always remembered the quot e in rev erse version but im not sure if i agree with either because im sure someone could be depressed not about the past, or anxious about not the future (self cringe for example). or someone could be in the future and not anxious (visualization). Why do i feel the need to end with a compliment?

8.1.19  3:54 am   how can i stop trying to be what inspires me the most and instead see how i can uniquely inspire when i haven't yet been inspired of what i have yet to do and when my past work inspires me being bittersweet since i want to do different things, but at the same time listening to my past makes me want to imitate it whenever it does inspire me. oh shit thats a long questions.

      why would you want to stop trying to be what inspires you the most

8.1.19  3:31 am   have u every tried thinking without words?

     yes

      howd it go?

     hard to describe

8.1.19  3:21 am   How do I overcome my crippling social anxiety?

     carry an item in your hand, such as an object

      Is it even possible to talk to strangers?

     no, that's because the moment you talk to them they are no longer strangers

8.1.19  1:54 am   how to be spiritual without falling into pseudoscience, sometimes it feels like the line is too thin or nonexistant

      science is spirit. spirit is science. whether or not the spiritualists or the scientists have either figured that out yet is their problem

I feel like I've accidentally made one character and her plotline very confusing, but I'm not sure if I should try to fix her and the plotline as I finish the draft or if I should just go ahead with my current confusing version of her plotline and then try to fix it in a later draft. What do you think I should do?

      speed up

      i was going to say "i was going to say no but now that i think about it yes" but i changed my mind and now i am not going to say that

      not necessary, the dang thing raids itself

7.31.19  7:16 pm   when making your song when do you decide what instruments to use

      you have to just guess. then see if it makes you flutter with aliveness, if not then guess again

7.31.19  7:04 pm   How do you arrange and perform "vocals day"? Seems through the latent writing process along with other issues that I expect occur to reach the perfection of the instrument tracks.  But the emotion and inflection is always so perfect as well.  I'm thinking of the example "textin' on my iphone" but all your songs would qualify.  It seems unfakeable, so how to you keep the emotion present while recording?  Or is your process actually pretty quick and painless, so that by vocals you're still just excited from how it's all coming together?  

      you always want it to be quick and painless, but ever since the technology has been invented to do it as many times as you want, and even piece together, i'm afraid almost zero people on the planet ever have quick and painless experiences any more. one of the very few tricks that does seem to work, if you can do something along the lines of convincing yourself that you have a very short time limit on the recording session. very scary but thrilling, and produces the best results i think. it's just as well, because your voice will wear out if you hammer it for too long on one session. another trick i should mention is try to do it bad
